poem:
Title: Upon Fractured Love

Broken promises are our bedfellows,
across silence we share stilted vows.
Temptation tempered love, grown weary,
his heart, once ardent, now dreary.

Evasive grunts replace the sonnet,
endearments lost, in sorrow we're caught.
Yet, I beg daily for reunion,
a return to our emotional communion.

Bedrooms of indifference, love's casualty,
a six year-long love misanthropy.
